oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bob McDill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1977 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Bob McDill. The recording takes place on 11-17-77.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob McDill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:16) -- Bob Allen discusses Bob McDill's song "Amanda," recorded by Don Williams. (0:41) -- Bob McDill mentions that Don Williams first heard the song through wall in his office. (2:05) -- Bob Allen asks about the influences of writing the song "Amanda." (3:40) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill whether he thought about taking an outside job while living in Nashville. (4:01) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill whether he's always written in the daytime (9AM-5PM). (5:08) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his previous musical experiences. Bob McDill explains that he played in a folk band in college. (7:15) -- Bob Allen shares a story and his experiences about traveling to South America.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McDill, Bob;
